newsitem.title: UK: Nws fixtures in sugar freight, but trend unclear.
newsitem.headline: Nws fixtures in sugar freight, but trend unclear.

text.p: A string of cargoes were fixed in the sugar freight market but all were on subjects and business was scattered with no clear direction, shipbrokers said on Wednesday.
Czarnikow Rionda fixed 14,000-17,000 tonnes bulk sugar from Rosario to USGulf or Atlantic for end October or early November.
Lorico fixed 10,000 tonnes bagged sugar from Rio to the Egyptian Med for early November and Jean Lion had 5,000-6,000 bagged sugar Continent to Algeria for prompt loading.
Jean Lion was also open to repeat 4,000 tonnes bagged prompt loading from the Continent to Algeria, brokers said.
